channel.title: Stuff.co.nz - Stuff
channel.description: Top Stories from Stuff.co.nz. New Zealand, world, sport, business & entertainment news on Stuff.co.nz.

item.title: Covid-19 live: Waikato's Mangatangi School a location of interest ahead of alert level decision
item.description: Queues are forming for tests after three positive Covid cases in Waikato, as ministers meet to decide if alert levels are moving.
item.dc:creator: Stuff

item.title: Covid-19: Waikato leaders angry at Government officials for allowing man to bring coronavirus across border
item.description: Outraged community leaders expect to see Auckland's outbreak border shifted south to cover parts of Hauraki.
item.dc:creator: LAWRENCE GULLERY

item.title: Covid-19: Cabinet could make ‘cautious' alert level decision to extend Auckland lockdown, adding Waikato, expert says
item.description: Professor Michael Baker says Cabinet might take the cautious approach to extend Auckland's lockdown for another week and add parts of the Waikato after household members of a remand prisoner tested positive in the region — including a pupil who was symptomatic at school.
item.dc:creator: COLLETTE DEVLIN

item.title: Covid-19 NZ: Auckland lockdown alert level decision to be announced at 4pm
item.description: Cabinet faces its toughest call on Covid-19 yet as it decides whether or not to take Auckland out of lockdown.
item.dc:creator: HENRY COOKE

item.title: 'I can't see them getting close': Laurie Mains slams Springboks before All Blacks test
item.description: Former ABs coach predicts Rieko Ioane and co will 'run riot' against South Africa, and says joining the Six Nations would be a huge mistake for them.
item.dc:creator: PAUL CULLY

item.title: Fire crews tackle blaze at warehouse in Auckland's Mt Wellington
item.description: A worker at a nearby office saw "heaps of smoke" and noticed “a very strong smell of burning plastic” coming from the building.
item.dc:creator: LUCY XIA AND MINA KERR-LAZENBY

item.title: Quiz: Take the three strikes trivia test for September 20, 2021
item.description: You get three chances to correctly rank the answers in today's question for September 20, 2021.
item.dc:creator: MATTHEW SLAUGHTER

item.title: Scott Dixon's IndyCar title hopes over
item.description: Frustrating season continues for defending champion who struggles in penultimate race in California.
item.dc:creator: STUFF SPORTS REPORTERS

item.title: Air New Zealand's Australian quarantine flights sell out in 'seconds'
item.description: The ticket allocation, which went live at 10am, showed all seats were sold out in about “30 seconds”, according to one frustrated customer.
item.dc:creator: ALAN GRANVILLE

item.title: Covid-19: Border worker takes test court case over legality of 'frontline' vaccination order
item.description: A woman who lost her Customs Service job for failing to have the Covid-19 vaccine says she was not able to challenge the need for vaccination in her role.
item.dc:creator: WELLINGTON HIGHER COURTS REPORTER

item.title: Covid-19: Auckland mayor pushes for level 3 move now almost 80% of city has one vaccine dose
item.description: With almost 80 per cent of the city vaccinated with a first dose, Phil Goff is calling for a move to alert level 3 amid mounting pressures on residents.
item.dc:creator: LUCY XIA

item.title: Funding confirmed for replacement of vital Ohakune bridge
item.description: An Ohakune rail overbridge, which is a crucial link for Ruapehu growers, will be replaced after a cash injection from the Government.
item.dc:creator: Stuff

item.title: Photographer takes first steps three months after helicopter crash
item.description: A photographer seriously injured in a wedding day helicopter crash says she hopes to reunite with the couple and document their second wedding day on their first anniversary.
item.dc:creator: ELLIE JAY OF RNZ

item.title: Planned balloon release for young Timaru homicide victims changed to flower float
item.description: Planned balloon release in honour of the three young girls allegedly killed by their mother in Timaru on Thursday night changed following an outcry of concern about the environmental impact.
item.dc:creator: ESTHER ASHBY-COVENTRY

item.title: Greyhounds take a stroll along Caroline Bay
item.description: Greyhounds in tutus and T-shirts enjoyed a leisurely stroll along Caroline Bay beach in Timaru as part of the annual Great Global Greyhound Walk.
item.dc:creator: YASHAS SRINIVASA

item.title: Manawatū gymnasts on the podium at national championship
item.description: Manawatū gymnasts were in good form at the national championships with a handful of athletes earning their way onto the podium.
item.dc:creator: MANAWATŪ REPORTER

item.title: Tabai Matson celebrates win in first game as coach of English rugby champions Harlequins
item.description: The Kiwi coach released by the Chiefs last year has hit the ground running at the helm of top London club.
item.dc:creator: STUFF SPORTS REPORTERS

item.title: Taranaki Country Lodge: Inside a North Island secret luxury lodge
item.description: This spectacular escape has stunning views of Mt Taranaki.
item.dc:creator: BROOK SABIN

item.title: Photos: Paragliding, 'meditation' in the air
item.description: Paragliding is like meditation for Taranaki man Rexy Felix – it’s what he does to relieve stress.
item.dc:creator: LISA BURD

item.title: Pitcairn Island's former mayor has trial for alleged public indecencies delayed
item.description: The ill health of the officer who arrested Michael Warren on three occasions and charged him has delayed the start of the trial.
item.dc:creator: EDWARD GAY
